comments.commentBody:
There are so many things disgustingly wrong about Mr. Walker's comments that its impossible to cover it all. Let me just focus on one.

It never ceases to amaze me that right-wingers are willing to so brazenly invoke the same battle cry as the Old Civil War South used to justify slavery. Of course, today when Republicans like Scott Walker use the term what they really mean is not the right to have slaves but rather the right to exploit people any way they can. The freedom of the rich and powerful (think of them as the modern day plantation owners) to exploit others in one way or another is the central hallmark and core value of the rightwing.

Then again when you use illegal immigrants to do your dirtiest work, paying them unconscionably little money for their labor because you can, only to have the police hunt them down as if they were rodents and throw them into prisons that is pretty much just like slavery.

We can set up affordable regional healthcare insurance which includes sex education, contraceptives & women's right to choose.
Then support public Education, pollution control & global warming initiatives and of course welcoming marriage & happiness for all. There are many other issues but this is a good start!

This is a truly Orwellian column by the viciously anti-worker, anti-family, anti-everything that's good and decent, Scott Walker.

Walker is a phony and a outright enemy of anyone who isn't rich, powerful or well-connected.

What he's written here is indicative of a proto-fascist mindset, i.e. "Ignore what people want and need, strip them of everything possible that makes their lives more decent and more secure, and if they object simply arrest them and destroy their lives.

Walker is a very dangerous man with a very bizarre and horrific mentality. Until we get people like him out of office, our country will never be as good as it needs to be.

Here's the mandate of the popular majority of the United States of America presenting itself in a proposed series of affirmative coffee mugs, T-shirts and demonstration signs:

Nevertheless we're King and not subordinates of a czar.

Nevertheless we're here and we speak freely. ("Ideal for your daily coffee table.")

Nevertheless we're free at last, free today, free real fast.

Nevertheless we're winning.

Nevertheless we're ending Niqab Capitalism and its financial hijack hijabs, Delaware veilwear and Bermudas and Bahamas burqas hiding trillions and trillions and trillions from us!

Nevertheless we love Mexicans and Muslims and Australians.

Nevertheless we're stronger together.

Nevertheless we shall overcome.

Nevertheless we can.

Now, that's mindshare and heartshare.

Not mindless blabla share to cover for an inferiority complex, for stealing and for cold callous calculating conscious hate. Though it must be annotated that hate and fear themselves are expressions of a lack of conscious awareness of who we really are.

My beautiful goofy granny coffee mug.

Elizabeth the Beautiful.

My beautiful yes Pocahontas no stupid criminal pipelines mug.

The content of this mug is consumer protected.

Nevertheless we have a constitution.

Nevertheless we are a democracy.

Nevertheless we shall overcome the gerrymander, the voter suppression, the voter roll purging, the Russian meddling, the Federal Bureaus of Innuendo and the bought disinformation media.

Nevertheless we can.

Your righteousness stops you from understanding liberalism. Returning authority to the states is like assuming religious institutions will pick up the tab for all the homeless, hungry and otherwise needy.  Most states are already very financially overburdened--they will simply not offer ramped up programs for job training, or health care.   Where will this leave all the jobless and uninsured?   Furthermore, I pay plenty of tax dollars to my state.  I want the tax money I send to the federal government to be applied to national programs that improve the quality of life for ALL Americans, so that people across the country get what they need.  I would be happy to pay more taxes to help--but no! I will probably be receiving a juicy tax cut.  I guess this will enable me to be more charitable, which will be much needed, as the likes of you take more and more away from the people.

I agree the the Republicans should stand strong. When the consequences of their denial of basic social, economic, climate, biological and physical science comes crashing down on their heads, they will be thrown out of power for a generation.
Mr. Scott says that "Despite the intimidation, we stood strong in our fight for taxpayers."  It's interesting that he characterizes the "right of the people peaceably to assemble" as intimidation.

Scott Walker was my favorite for president at the beginning of the campaign.
But like the others he proved spineless in taking on Trump.
Now he's carrying water for the demagogue who has nothing in common with Ronald Reagan, whom Walkers cites for some reason.
Governor Walker has proven a remarkably resilient governor of Wisconsin, but that's his ceiling. He's got nothing to offer other than that, as this weak essay demonstrates.

Too bad Trump wasn't a teacher making $50K/yr. Then Walker would have taken him on with everything he had!  Seems who really intimidates Walker are billionaires.  He doesn't want to upset them.  Can't imagine why.

If Mr. Walker's proposals had been popular with Americans, Mr. Walker would not have felt forced to drop out early in the presidential race.

Remember these boots that marched in the thirties and early fourties of the past century?

These boots also stifled protests and had draconian punishments in place for organizers and participants and cracked down on them military style.

Deez boots are made for Walker and all crap talk Twitter Talker?

As usual, a Republican, dismisses the hundreds of death threats received by every Planned Parenthood office and every abortion provider, ignores the nearly 20:1 ratio of right-wing attacks to left-wing attacks, and bemoans the few they face while ignoring the rest.

Since the election, there have been far more attacks and threats just to Jewish community centers, synagogues, mosques and Islamic centers by alt-right thugs than ALL the incidents of threats and attacks by leftists combined. Mr. Walker's state is only in good shape because of cooked books and he doesn't seem to notice that in his own words, companies can't get people to move to Wisconsin to work there.

We've seen what happens to states run by people like Walker, Brownback in Kansas(the worst!), Scott in Florida, Pence in Indiana. And we've seen how Democrats make their states prosper in Washington, California, New York, etc.

Of the 30 states Trump won, 26 are subsidized, and only 4 (Texas, Florida, Michigan and Wisconsin) pay in more than they take out.

Of the 20 states Clinton won, only 6 are subsidized (2 because they surround DC and agencies like the Pentagon and NIH are in the environs, not DC), 13 are donors, and 1 breaks even.

So we see how well Red states do: Without the subsidies from Blue states almost all are bankrupt.

Walker never did require the rich to take drug tests when he doled out $250 million for a sports stadium. Walker is okay with state government in Republican hands but not city, town, or county governments in local Democrat hands.

YOU LIE!

Oh, sorry, a waking dream while nodding off...Scott Walker delivered the State of the Union. He reported with glee that unions in his state have been reduced to organizing boy scouts because it's bad for working Americans to join forces to demand fair pay, safe and proper working conditions. As he says in speeches, "slaves didn't need unions to deal with plantation owners so I have no sympathy for working whites who want unions jobs but not work."

Walker wants to "stand strong in our fight for taxpayers." That's why Wisconsin takes more federal tax money from Washington than it pays. In other words, it's another lazy, shiftless state that depends on the charity of taxpayers in Minnesota, California, New York, Massachusetts. Without the United part of States of America, Walker's state rights agenda would file for bankruptcy as often as Trump.

Walker and Trump share another trait. Both think they're smarter than anyone so there's nothing they can't figure out. Everything's easy. Government? Piece of cake. Just sign orders you haven't read at photo ops and then it's watching cable news and tweeting. Walker's extensive experience consists of dropping out of Marquette, working for the Red Cross and then collecting public paychecks as county executive, state assembly, and then governor.

Never ran a business. No degree in anything. A typical career politician defined by raw ambition, not public service.

He's the problem in need of a solution.

Gov. Walker, the people were not given a choice in November that had anything to do with policy. Between Trump's race baiting and constant lies, Comey's blatant disruption of the election with his illegal announcement, and Russia's clear involvement in our election at the behest of your party and President, the voters did not make a clear choice. They did no such thing. Your President is treasonous, having colluded with a foreign power and adversary of the United States of America. Your party is criminal, having interfered with a fair and free election. Your President is illegitimate, having stolen power against the will of the people and losing his election to the tune of millions of votes.

Please ask your President to admit guilt and resign peacefully, or these protests will continue to get worse. And God help you if you take health insurance away from millions and sentence many to death.
If only you could comprehend how little I care about what the Pope thinks.
The Pope thinks you should treat human beings with compassion and respect. You may not like the messenger, but do you have a problem with the message?
If you could only comprehend how little the Pope cares about what you think.

I also could care less what the Pope thinks. I don't need him to tell me what I viscerally knew the first time I encountered a homeless person--give them money and be as generous as you can. And it is none of my business what the recipient does with the money. And, yes,I know that many panhandlers are pros taking advantage of the plight of the real homeless and my good will. It is just like voting: you have to vote in every election to elect a few honest candidates in a lifetime.

Yes,
Scotty stood strong when faced with thousands of protesters made up mostly by teachers made up mostly by women teachers. He is such a macho man.

Mr. Walker.
Our country's founders established a Constitution that strikes a balance between federal and state responsibilities. There is a place for both. The work accomplished by organized labor in this country cannot be underestimated: Fair wages, safe work conditions, a 40-hour work week, etc.. You, sir, are not on any "high road".

Scott Walker is a wholly owned subsidiary of the Koch brothers. Returning power to the states was the battle cry of the confederacy and of right wing idealogues ever since. Oh, and it was the electoral college that sent Trump to Washington - not the people.

Right. Just what his employers, the Koch brothers, ordered.

About Scott Walker's failed presidential bid, the Atlantic wrote in September 2015:

" Scott Walker’s fall was especially precipitous. The Wisconsin governor’s campaign lasted just 70 days. He came in as the Iowa frontrunner and departed a few weeks later as an asterisk, with too little support even to be assigned a number in the last national poll."

Maybe Republican elected officials will want to take his advice to stand against their constituents.

Or maybe not.

I have come to believe this, too. Why should the blue areas, who raise most of the money in the country, have to send their tax dollars to DC where it then gets sent to the racist Bible states who send people to DC to take away programs and aid from the blue states? It makes zero sense. Let's keep our own money.

The Governor is treating healthcare as a state issue. It is, and must be, a national issue. The analogy that Walker draws to his handling of Wisconsin labor unions does not apply. Dismantle it as Walker suggests and the push-back will be felt by Congress.

Mr. Walker must think his GOP peers are as talented as he is when he advises them to do as he did and stick their fingers in their ears and thumb their noses at the millions who vehemently disagree with the direction that he and the Party of the 1% are trying to take us.

He's a fine one to talk about how our Founders envisioned our democracy, while denying one of the most fundamental rights of democracy: the right of the People to be heard. In fact, he is the product of anti-democracy, having risen to power with the backing of a cabal fo the rich and powerful, led by the Koch brothers. It's galling to here someone like Scott Walker, who led the union busting, to even utter the word "Founders", as he is so far from their ideals, he might well have fought for King George were he alive then.

Be careful Mr. Walker about invoking the ideals of our Founding Fathers, the People might just remember what they actually stood for.
Expect to see families with children having bankrupting serious illnesses move to the states that will cover them.

The GOP lost its way as a cohesive credible political force focused on financial conservatism.  Republicans have grabbed power at the local and state level through the flow of massive amounts of dark money supporting the expansion of the Tea Party extreme right and the growth of Taliban-style religious fundamentalism.  Republicans are now focused on racial hate mongering, Islamophobia, and disrespect for a woman's rights to seek healthcare on her own terms. But the GOP message no longer resonates with the majority of the American people although it does energize the frenzied right wing extremists who are the base. The steady stream of outrageous mindless political statements by Trump has become a focal point of media fascination.  Trump's actions have energized major public protests around the country. Republican Party leaders while burying their heads in the sand as they laud Trump are now worried about their Congressional majority and they should be.  They are reaping the whirlwind.
Sorry Scotty, but liberals are not attached to federal government. Only to fair, progressive legislation at all levels. Go back to school. But not a De Vos school.
Without belaboring points made by others in the commentairiat already with more coming as the sun comes up.  I will simply observe that perhaps it's Gov. Walker who needs the drug test.
